availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: George W. Riley (Washington County, Kentucky, farmer, attorney and captain)

body.p: Washington County, Kentucky, attorney and soldier. Kentucky native. Farmer and attorney in Washington County, Kentucky, in 1860. Served in the 10th Kentucky Infantry (U.S.A.) as captain from November 21, 1861, to December 6, 1864.

ab.bibl:
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Washington County, District 2, p. 54.
Compiled Service Records of Volunteer Union Soldiers who Served in Organizations From State of Kentucky, NARA RG 94, Microfilm Series M397, Roll 242.
U.S. Civil War Pension Index: General Index to Pension Files, 1861-1934, NARA RG 15, Microfilm Series T288, Kentucky, Application #1118376.
Find A Grave, "Capt. George W. Riley (unknown-Feb 2, 1918)," Memorial #80422207, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/80422207 (accessed September 5, 2020).
